findings.title: Block gas limit
findings.description: The massUpdatePools(), updateStartBlock() functions can fail due to block gas limit if the pool size is too big.

findings.title: Sending tokens to dead address instead of burning
findings.description: Tokens are sent to a dead address in overridden _transfer functions rather than being burned in the token contract.

findings.title: 10% of user reward amount goes to dev address
findings.description: The smart contract has a functionality where 10% of the user's reward amount is sent to the developer's address.

findings.title: Harvest fee amount goes to burn address
findings.description: The harvest fee amount is sent to a burn address instead of being handled properly.

findings.title: Owner Can Drain Tokens Sent to Referral Contract
findings.description: The owner has the privilege to drain tokens sent to the referral contract, which can be useful for withdrawing tokens sent by mistake to the contract.

findings.title: Owner can change the operator of the referral contract
findings.description: The owner has the privilege to modify the operator of the referral contract.

findings.title: Owner can change referral commission rate
findings.description: The contract owner has the privilege to modify the referral commission rate.

findings.title: Timekeeper address can change start block
findings.description: The Timekeeper address has the privilege to modify the start block.

findings.title: Operator can exclude and include in antiWhale
findings.description: The operator has privileges to exclude and include in antiWhale functionality.

findings.title: Operator can exclude and include in fee
findings.description: The operator has privileges to exclude and include in fee which could lead to potential security risks.
